quiz.question: Which of the following is a primary legal framework governing cybersecurity in many countries?
options: General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)
International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR)
Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA)
Sarbanes-Oxley Act
quiz.hint: This regulation is particularly important in the European Union.

quiz.question: What is a key difference between ethical hacking and illegal hacking?
options: Ethical hacking is always unapproved, illegal hacking is approved
Ethical hacking aims to fix vulnerabilities, illegal hacking exploits them
Ethical hacking never involves penetration testing, illegal hacking does
Ethical hackers use different tools from illegal hackers
quiz.hint: Consider the intent and permission involved in each type of hacking.

quiz.question: Which of the following is a major concern of intellectual property laws in the context of cyber law?
options: Data encryption standards
Protection of software code and digital media
Network security protocols
User authentication methods
quiz.hint: This involves the protection of creations of the mind in the digital space.

quiz.question: What is the main purpose of privacy laws in cybersecurity?
options: To ensure companies can freely share user data
To protect personal data from unauthorized access
To allow governments to monitor all online activities
To prevent cyber attacks on national infrastructure
quiz.hint: These laws focus on safeguarding personal information.

quiz.question: Which of the following is often a part of a professional code of conduct in cybersecurity?
options: Mandatory reporting of all security breaches
Personal use of company resources is allowed
Ignoring minor security threats
Obtaining user consent before accessing data
quiz.hint: Consider the importance of user consent and ethical standards in professional practices.
